G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ubiorum finibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultis et his mecum pariter considere regnis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 349</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in novam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.9" n="4" level="3"> Of inanim. objects, esp. of places, <hi rend="ital">to settle, sink down, sink in, give way, subside</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Veliterno agro terra ingentibus cavernis consedit arboresque in profundum haustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 38, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra in ingentem sinum consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alpes) jam licet considant!</quote> <trans><tr>may now sink down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne mihi visum considere in ignis Ilium,</quote> <trans><tr>to sink down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 624</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 145</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilium ardebat, neque adhuc consederat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cinerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:185" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnia sacra profanaque in ignem considerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quā mitescentia Alpium juga considunt, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">are lower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiemur picem considere, et cum siderit, aquam eliquabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec consideret pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in cacuminibus montium nubes consident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 82, § 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidi considunt fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:291" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 291</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10504.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa bona in pectore consident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia cujus in mente consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 12, 24</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: totam videmus Consedisse urbem luctu, <hi rend="ital">sunk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immersed in grief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 350</bibl> (in luctum esse demersum, Serv.). —</sense><sense id="n10504.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10504.13" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To settle down permanently, sink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc totum (genus dicendi) in eā mediocritate consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam ego incipio secedere et in aliā parte considere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>change the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10504.14" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">To lose force, abate, subside, diminish; to be appeased, quieted, to cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor animi cum consedit, omnis illa vis et quasi flamma oratoris exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consederit furor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocia ab re bene gestā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus terror ab necopinato visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia praesentia satis consederant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consedit utriusque nomen in quaesturā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has since that time ceased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10504.15" n="b" level="4"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to sink; to conclude, end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum verborum junctio nascatur a proceris numeris ac liberis... sed varie distincteque considat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consignate: <entryFree id="n10505" type="main" key="consigna_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consigno, <sense id="n10505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consignatio: <entryFree id="n10506" type="main" key="consigna_ti_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātīo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consigno</etym>, <sense id="n10506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a written proof, a document</hi> (post-class. and rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 11</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:16:section=2 al" default="NO">48, 10, 16, § 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
consignatus: <entryFree id="n10507" type="main" key="consigna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from consigno.</entryFree>
consigno: <entryFree id="n10508" type="main" key="consigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-signo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10508.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish with a seal, to affix, put one's seal to, to seal, to sign, subscribe</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10508.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas signis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatio consignata cretā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id decretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 48, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conscripta consignataque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas dotis,</quote> <trans><tr>a marriage contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl></cit> (for which, briefly, dotem, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl>): tabulas proprio lino, propriāque cerā, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:64" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10508.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attest, certify, establish, vouch for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentis testata consignataque antiquitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs judicia, quae publicis populi Romani litteris monumentisque consignata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <pb n="432" /> <cb n="CONS" /> auctoritates nostras, <hi rend="ital">to place beyond doubt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:50:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 50, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 11, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10508.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To note, write down, to register, record</hi> (so lit. aud trop.; for the most part only in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10508.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos publicis commentariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam publicam (legum) publicis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motum temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10508.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: tot rerum atque tantarum insitae et quasi consignatae in animis notiones. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl>: causam, de quā, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make known, indicate</hi> (with exprimere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consignātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (of the <pos>P. a.</pos> consignatus, a, um, not in use; Hertz, consignatius); <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to II.,</quote> <trans><tr>in a distinct manner, plainly, distinctly; comp</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus consignatissime factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced.</sense></entryFree>
consilesco: <entryFree id="n10509" type="main" key="consi^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭlesco</orth>, <itype>sĭlŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become still, to be hushed, keep silent, grow dumb</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 9</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 575 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:22" default="NO">12, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consiliarius: <entryFree id="n10510" type="main" key="consi^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consilium</etym>, <sense id="n10510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for counsel, counselling</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n10510.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis consiliarius amicus quam auxiliarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:39:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 168.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a counsellor, adviser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliario et auctore Vestorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verris) amici et consiliarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AVGVSTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10510.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10510.3" n="A" level="2"> T. t., <hi rend="ital">an assessor, aid in a court of justice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10510.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the augur as the <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi> of the divine will: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliarius atque administer Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consiliatio: <entryFree id="n10511" type="main" key="consi^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consilior</etym>, <sense id="n10511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consulting, counselling</hi>, Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 14 Mai, dub.</sense></entryFree>
consiliator: <entryFree id="n10512" type="main" key="consi^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counsellor</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">maleficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliator et rector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 36</bibl></cit>.—As an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> p. 7</bibl>, n. 6.</sense></entryFree>
consiliatrix: <entryFree id="n10513" type="hapax" key="consi^li^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consiliator</etym>, <sense id="n10513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who counséls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae consiliatrices tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consiligo: <entryFree id="n10514" type="main" key="consi^li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lungwort</hi>: Pulmonaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:1" default="NO">6, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 48, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 21, § 38 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consilinum: <entryFree id="n10515" type="main" key="Consi^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consĭlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified town in Bruttium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>:</sense></entryFree>
consilinas: <entryFree id="n10516" type="main" key="Consi^li_na_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consĭlīnās</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Consilinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consilior: <entryFree id="n10517" type="main" key="consi^li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>consilium</etym>. <sense id="n10517.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take counsel, to consult</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consiliandi causā colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilis ad consiliandum legatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10517.1" n="II" level="1"> Alicui (prop. to take counsel for one, in one's favor; hence), <hi rend="ital">to impart counsel, to counsel, advise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consiliosus: <entryFree id="n10518" type="main" key="consi^li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of prudence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wisdom, considerate</hi>, etc., a word formed, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 12</bibl>, by Cato (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl></cit> (in imitation of Cato).—* <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consilium: <entryFree id="n10519" type="main" key="consi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from con and root sal-; Sanscr. sar-; cf. consul</etym>, <sense id="n10519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deliberation, consultation, a considering together, counsel</hi> (cf. concilium; very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10519.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta sunt consilia,</quote> <trans><tr>are finished, at an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in consilio consuluistis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium volo capere unā tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pol consili locum habeo neque ad auxilium copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo consilia conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit> (v. confero, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in senatu consilia versata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:2" default="NO">7, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero consilii sit res, et non necesse sit, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>as if the matter were yet open for deliberation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid efficere possis, tui consilii est,</quote> <trans><tr>is for you to consider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum jam consilium est. non solum meum, quid sit vobis faciendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: quid aetati credendum sit, quid nomini,<cb n="CONS" />  magni consilii est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 12, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mihi adhuc accidit, quod majoris consilii esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consilio habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit publici consilii particeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:4" default="NO">3, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanis ut interesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10519.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10519.3" n="A" level="2"> In abstr. </sense><sense id="n10519.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A conclusion made with consideration, a determination, resolution, measure, plan, purpose, intention</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium est aliquid faciendi aut non faciendi excogitata ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sunt Gallorum subita et repentina consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid communi consilio agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium communicaverunt perfeceruntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificandi consilium abicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 103</bibl></cit>.—And of the <hi rend="ital">purpose.</hi> as opp. to the act, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod initio scripsi, totius facti tui judicium non tam ex consilio tuo quam ex eventu homines esse facturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi exitus rerum, non hominum consilia, legibus vindicentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem peccare, non corpus, et unde consilium afuerit culpam abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 9</bibl></cit>. —Often with epithets characterizing the person who forms the purpose, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">amentissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 32, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissima cousilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 38, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">providens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudio quod consilium primum intenderam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo consilio, uti frumento Caesarem intercluderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo consilio huc imus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: hoc consilio ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: privato consilio, <hi rend="ital">on one's own account</hi> (opp. publico consilio, in the name or behalf of the state): <cit><quote lang="la">qui contra consulem privato consilio exercitus comparaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 2</bibl>.—Sometimes <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> consilio adverbially, <hi rend="ital">intentionally, designedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu potius quam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul, seu forte, seu consilio, Venusiam perfugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.5" n="b" level="4"> Esp. in the phrases, </sense><sense id="n10519.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Consilium capere, <hi rend="ital">to form a purpose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plan, to resolve, decide, determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, quid nunc consili capiam, scio, De virgine istac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: consilium capere with a <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 34, 4</bibl>; 10, 38, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:7:1" default="NO">8, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:180" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:1" default="NO">34, 4, 1</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectionis et reversionis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 6 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capio consilium, ut senatum congerronum convocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium ceperunt plenum sceleris, ut nomen hujus deferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium cepi, ut antequam luceret exirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7</bibl></cit>. 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 34, 7</bibl>.—And with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium cepit ... iter in urbem patefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis fortunas evertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclius capit consilium ... non adesse ad judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex oppido profugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 35, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.7" n="(b)" level="5"> In the same sense, inire consilium, with similar construction: <cit><quote lang="la">inita sunt consilia urbis delendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">38, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni occupandi consilium inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 38, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus gentium cujus violandi causā consilium initum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 25, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris conandi consilia inierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:6" default="NO">2, 80, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci consilium ineunt interrumpendi pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniit consilia reges Lacedaemoniorum tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia inibat, quemadmodum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bello consilia inire incipiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de recuperandā libertate consilium initum videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia inita de regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox consilium init, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Freq. consilium est, with and without <hi rend="ital">inf., I purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:61:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 61, 16</bibl> Dietsch. <cb n="CONS" /> —Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut filius Cum illà habitet ... hoc nostrum consilium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea uti acceptā mercede deseram, non est consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 8</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sui consilii sit, ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10519.9" n="c" level="4"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a warlike measure, device, stratagem</hi>: consilium imperatorium quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">strath/ghma</foreign> appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphicr. 1, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunus consiliis locus (= insidiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.10" n="d" level="4"> With special reference to the person for whose advantage a measure is devised, <hi rend="ital">counsel, advice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quidem antehac aliis solebas dare consilia mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid das consili?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cethegum minus ei fidele consilium dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos lene consilium datis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 45</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvabo aut re aut operā aut consilio bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Ter.: aut consolando aut consilio aut re juvero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit> (quoted ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 4</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 31, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hortor ut omnia moderere prudentiā tuā, ne te auferant aliorum consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliquid impertivit tibi sui consilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliis, non curribus utere nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile ratio tam salubris consilii accepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saniora consilia pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.11" n="2" level="3"> As a mental quality, <hi rend="ital">understanding, judgment, wisdom, sense, penetration, prudence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dominari in corpore toto Consilium quod nos animum mentemque vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 450</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta illa res est animo virili, consilio puerili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut popularis cupiditas a consilio principum dissideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:49:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 49, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore studio quam consilio ad bellum proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 96, 4</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">res forte quam consilio melius gestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 92, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quanto consilio gerantur, nullo consilio adsequi possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul consilium cum re amisisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miseros prudentia prima relinquit, Et sensus cum re consiliumque fugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres omnes propter infirmitatem consilii majores in tutorum potestate esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir et consilii magni et virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plus in illo senili animo non consilii modo sed etiam virtutis esse dicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tam iners, tam nulli consili Sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est hoc principium improbi animi, miseri ingenii, nulli consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes gravioris aetatis, in quibus aliquid consilii aut dignitatis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">misce stultitiam consiliis brevem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res in se neque consilium neque modum Habet ullum, eam consilio regere non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10519.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii inopes ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>indiscreet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis consili expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 266</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.13" n="B" level="2"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">the persons who deliberate, a council;</hi> of the Roman senate: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum, id est orbis terrae consilium, delere gestit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum consilium orbis terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di prohibeant, ut hoc, quod majores consilium publicum vocari voluerunt, praesidium sectorum existimetur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a court of justice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex civitate in senatum propter dignitatem, ex senatu in hoc consilium delecti estis propter severitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of the division of the centumviri, who sat for ordinary cases in four consilia: <cit><quote lang="la">sedebant centum et octoginta judices, tot enim quattuor consiliis colliguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus non solum consiliis sed etiam sententiis superior discessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba consilio celeriter convocato sententias exquirere coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>a council of war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio advocato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:22:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 22, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittunt (Carthaginienses) triginta seniorum principes: id erat sanctius apud illos consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 34, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum atque sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:2 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10519.14" n="b" level="4"> Facetiously: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper tace, Dum ego mihi consilia in animum convoco, et dum consulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10519.15" n="c" level="4"> (Acc. to II. A. <pb n="433" /> <cb n="CONS" /> 1. c.) <hi rend="ital">A counsellor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ferox hortator pugnae consiliumque fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clymene, Aethraque, Quae mihi sunt comites consiliumque duae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 268; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:276" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consimilis: <entryFree id="n10520" type="main" key="consi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., similar in all respects, entirely similar, like</hi> (class.; most freq. in Plaut., Ter., and Lucr.; not in Hor.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen., dat., atque, quasi</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10520.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber captivus avis ferae consimilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 397 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 811</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:711" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 711</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 149</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10520.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui homini erus est consimilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10520.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam consimili'st atque ego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 287</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Or. 1</bibl>; and with <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 8</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">que</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 231</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10520.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia consimile est quom stertas quasi sorbeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: via, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 316, 9</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 135 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1018" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1018</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 736</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:916" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 916</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:842" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 842</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:884" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 884</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1097" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1097</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: studio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 13</bibl>: pariter cadentia et consimilia irascentem, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 102</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In a doubtful constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">fecerunt, ut consimilis fugae profectio videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojus mos maxumest consimilis vostrum, hi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭmĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; only in the phrase et consimilia, after enumerations, <hi rend="ital">and the like, and similar things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga, tunicae, paenulae et consimilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:23:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 23, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 102</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very similarly, in like manner</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">consimiliter Cicero verbo isto utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:8" default="NO">11, 5, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> not in use either in <pos>adj.</pos> or <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
consimiliter: <entryFree id="n10521" type="main" key="consi^mi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consimilis <sense id="n10521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consimilo: <entryFree id="n10522" type="main" key="consi^mi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sĭmĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>consimilis</etym>, <sense id="n10522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to compare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalum Jovi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
consipio: <entryFree id="n10523" type="main" key="consi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sapio</etym>, <sense id="n10523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in one's right mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in one's senses, to be of sound mind</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non mentibus solum consipere, sed ne auribus quidem atque oculis satis constare poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis consipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 3, 12.</sense></entryFree>
consiptum: <entryFree id="n10524" type="main" key="consiptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consiptum</orth>, v. consaepio <sense id="n10524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consistio: <entryFree id="n10525" type="main" key="consisti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consistĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consisto</etym>, <sense id="n10525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing still</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>in a place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consisto: <entryFree id="n10526" type="main" key="consisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stĭtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to place one's self anywhere, to stand still, stand, halt, stop, make a stop</hi> (very freq. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10526.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10526.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hunc non ausim praeterire, quin consistam et conloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiose nunc jam ilico hic consiste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ad ipsum veni diverticulum, constiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti et viatores consistere cogant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque is (Demosthenes) consistens in loco, sed inambulans atque ascensu ingrediens arduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ludius constitit aut tibicen repente conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura scribam ad te cum constitero: nunc eram plane in medio mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: constitit nusquam primo quam ad Vada venit, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus oppidis consistere praetores et conventum agere solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae post praeturam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: ire modo ocius, interdum consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in muro consistendi potestas erat nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ordines, tota in illā contione Italia constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mensam consistere et ministrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:510" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:766" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:653" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:674" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:601" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 601</bibl></cit>; and with a simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">limine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 486</bibl></cit>; 9, 397; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:123" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 541</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calce aliquem super ipsum debere consistere,</quote> <trans><tr>trample on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10526.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set, become hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore constitit Ister,</quote> <trans><tr>has been frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 662</bibl></cit>: sanguis, Poët. ap. Cic. <cb n="CONS" /> Tusc. 2, 17, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">156, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam perfecte mustum deferbuit et constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">album ex ovo, quo facilius consistat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 20, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo, to station</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place one's self with some one for conversation, to stand with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc jam loco cum altero Constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 16 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc consistit, hunc amplexatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take one's place, take position, assume a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attitude</hi> for an action, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of a musician: ut constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an actor: in scaenā vero postquam solus constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an orator: in communibus suggestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesopus mediā subito in turbā constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for shooting: post acer Mnestheus adducto constitit arcu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 507</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of athletes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 426</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duas acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 19, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10526.7" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to halt, make a halt, take a position, to make a stand</hi> (opp. to a march, flight, or disorder): <cit><quote lang="la">locus, ubi constitissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in superiore acie constiterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinistrā parte acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fluctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub muro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Ariovisti pari intervallo constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit utrumque agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic regii constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 58, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut reliquae (legiones) consistere non auderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis superioribus consistere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves eorum nostris adversae constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.8" n="5" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to appear as accuser before a court of justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum debitoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum matre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:53" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.9" n="6" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert animus propius consistere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>take a nearer view</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 467</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have a stand</hi> as a dealer, <hi rend="ital">occupy a place of business</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ede ubi consistas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:296" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">IN SCHOLA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4085</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum consistendi Romanis in Galliā non fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10526.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to rest, remain, stand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 332</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiamini eo transire illius turpitudinis infamiam, ubi cetera maleficia consistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unde orta culpa esset, ibi poena consisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos rectum pietasque pudorque constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 73</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10526.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10526.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pause, to dwell upon, delay, stop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uno nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa mihi veritas manum inicit et paulisper consistere et commorari cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:35:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 35, 120</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista quae spectantur, ad quae consistitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10526.15" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remain firm, unshaken, immovable, steadfast, to be at rest, to stand one's ground, to continue, endure, subsist, be, exist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neque mente nec linguā neque ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare in forensibus causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:39:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 39, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo quidem superabis me ipso judice, re autem ne consistes quidem ullo judice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the cause itself: quia magistratus aliquis reperiebatur, apud quem Alfeni causa consisteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 22, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: modo ut tibi constiterit fructus otii tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (viro) non modo culpa nulla, sed ne suspitio quidem potuit consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 152</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 29, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confiteor ... me consistere in meo praesidio sic, ut non fugiendi hostis sed capiendi loci causā cessisse videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam consistere tutam,</quote> <trans><tr>to remain, continue safe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit in nullā qui fuit ante color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt certi denique fines, Quos ultra citraque nequit consistere rectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales cum vertice celso Aëriae quercus constiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo in loco, nullā in personā ... consistunt (ista quae vires atque opes humanae vocantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val.
