conspersio: <entryFree id="n10579" type="main" key="conspersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspersĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">consparsĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conspergo</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n10579.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a scattering, strewing, sprinkling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra salis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10579.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">paste, dough</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conspersus: <entryFree id="n10580" type="main" key="conspersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspersus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">consparsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conspergo.</entryFree>
conspicabilis: <entryFree id="n10581" type="main" key="conspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conspicor</etym> (eccl. Lat.). <sense id="n10581.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Visible</hi>: ore, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 631. <cb n="CONS" /> —</sense><sense id="n10581.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Remarkable, notable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
conspicabundus: <entryFree id="n10582" type="hapax" key="conspi^ca_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conspicor</etym>, <sense id="n10582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">considering attentively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas virginem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 803</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspiciendus: <entryFree id="n10583" type="main" key="conspi^ci^endus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conspicio.</entryFree>
conspicientia: <entryFree id="n10584" type="main" key="conspi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n10584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the faculty of considering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum conspicien tiam habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspicillum: <entryFree id="n10585" type="main" key="conspi^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcillum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭlĭum</orth>, Plaut. Fragm ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 7</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place to look from</hi>, and, transf., <hi rend="ital">a watching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspicillo consecutu'st me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. unde conspici possis, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
conspicio: <entryFree id="n10586" type="main" key="conspi^ci^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at attentively, to get sight of, to descry, perceive, observe</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10586.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10586.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter eas regiones, quā oculi conspiciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me interrogas, Qui ipsus equidem nunc primum istanc tecum conspicio semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae aedes ... quas quotiensquomque conspicio, fleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si queat usquam Conspicere amissum fetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 358</bibl></cit>: quandoque te in jure conspicio, Leg. Act. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut procul novum vehiculum Argonautarum e monte conspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque ... quae prima signa conspexit, ad haec constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum apud se in castris Ariovistus conspexisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum nostros equites conspexerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 26: sidus in regione caeli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui lucus ex insulā conspiciebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspici inter se,</quote> <trans><tr>to be visible to one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter se conspecti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc simulac cupido conspexit lumine virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectis luminibus crebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum insidiis conspeximus ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi tunc primum, tunc est conspecta supremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tabernaculum ... unde ab omnibus conspici posset, imago Solis fulgebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspecto delatore ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugas in speculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua in undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:794" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:731" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 731</bibl></cit>.—Of an inanimate subject: <cit><quote lang="la">si illud signum (Jovis) solis ortum et forum curiamque conspiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accus.</hi>, when an action, condition, etc., is the object: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (matrem) paucis ante diebus laureatam in suā gratulatione conspexit, eandem, etc. ... eundem (filium) spoliatum omni dignitate conspiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata volgi pedibus detrita viarum Saxea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiora loca multitudine armatorum completa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos laborantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ex nave egredientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem conspiciens ad se ferentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves suas oppletas serpentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibalem) humi jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adrasum quendam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 49</bibl></cit>; cf., <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis non alius flectere equum sciens Aeque conspicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interim Metellus, monte degrediens cum exercitu, conspicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit> dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. conspicor: terribilior niger conspicitur (canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ut exanimum siquod procul ipse jacere Conspicias hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nostros victores flumen transisse conspexerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum procurrere currus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, 64, 389</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.6" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to look at with admiration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close attention, to gaze upon, observe, contemplate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10586.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc supina sursum in caelum conspicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orabat, ne se, quem paulo ante cum egregiā stirpe conspexissent, orbum liberis facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrium ut pacis auctorem cum ingenti favore conspiciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum omnes conspicerent propter novitatem ornatūs ignotamque formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bene notum Porticus Agrippae te conspexerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: conspici, <hi rend="ital">to attract attention, to be conspicuous, noticed, observed, distinguished, admired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania sunt ista ... delectamenta paene puerorum, captare plausus, vehi per urbem, conspici velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: in gestu nec <pb n="436" /> <cb n="CONS" /> venustatem conspiciendam, nec turpitudinem esse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic quisque hostem ferire, murum adscendere, conspici dum tale facinus faceret, properabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex modica, non multa, ut in neutram partem conspici posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid te ut regium juvenem conspici sinis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime conspectus ipse est, curru equis albis juncto urbem invectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitus nihil inter aequales excellens, arma atque equi conspiciebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum Conspicitur nitidis fundata pecunia villis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu formosissimus alto Conspiceris caelo ( = inter deos versaris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima bonis animi conspicerere tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 137</bibl>.—Less freq. in an unfavorable sense, <hi rend="ital">to be notorious, to be gazed at with dislike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carere me adspectu civium quam infestis oculis omnium conspici mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: ne quid faciat, quod conspici et derideri posset, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10586.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perceive mentally, to understand, comprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis in rem quae sint meam ego conspicio mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego nunc corde conspicio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conspiciatis eum mentibus, quoniam oculis non potestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus error talis in L. Aemilio Paulo conspectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10586.10" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">having understanding, intelligent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quas (contumelias) despiciendas non sapiente opus est viro, sed tantum conspiciente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 16, 3</bibl></cit> Haase (al. consipiente). —</sense><sense id="n10586.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10586.12" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus hosti conspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina inter se satis conspecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10586.13" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Striking, distinguished, remarkable, gazed at</hi>, = conspicuus (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas chlamyde et pictis conspectus in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 588</bibl></cit> (conspicuus, conspicabilis, Serv.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">victor Tyrio in ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris avique fama conspectum eum faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus elatusque supra modum hominis privati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 796</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:140 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 140 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> apparently not in use.—</sense><sense id="n10586.14" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">worth seeing, worthy of attention, distinguished</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">insideat celeri conspiciendus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nemesis donis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyas formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:170" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater formosa Inter Dictaeos greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus vel in hac magnificentiā urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:261" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:50:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 50, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10587" type="hapax" key="conspi^ci^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n10587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the survey taken by the augur in fixing the limits of the</hi> templum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
conspicor: <entryFree id="n10588" type="main" key="conspi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to get sight of, to descry, see, perceive</hi> (very freq. in Plaut. and Caes.; several times in Ter.; elsewh. rare; never in Lucr., Cic., Virg., or Hor.). </sense><sense id="n10588.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quemquam conspicor alium in viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epidicumne ego conspicor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aedis erum meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2, 9: in tenebris conspicatus si sis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ajacem) occisum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 45 al.</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 25 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc conspicatae naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10588.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic quis est, quem huc advenientem conspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritos hostes conspicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl> and 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10588.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">illam geminos filios pueros peperisse conspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10588.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res in nostris castris gererentur conspicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempla et conspicare idem esse apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interim Metellus ... conspicatur, primo dubius quidnam insolita facies ostenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch; Jacobs ad loc. (where MSS. have conspicitur, v. conspicio, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>; but cf. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 102</bibl>).!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass., to be seen</hi>: ut nunc paupertas<cb n="CONS" />  conspicatur (<foreign lang="greek">qewrei=tai</foreign>), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
conspicuus: <entryFree id="n10589" type="main" key="conspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. conspicio</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose, esp. in Tac.; not in Quint.). <sense id="n10589.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">comes in view, visible;</hi> opp. occultus: <cit><quote lang="la">quot inter Occultum stellae conspicuumque polum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus ab auditis conspicuisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: late vertex, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum in proeliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies barbarorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernaculum undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: sidus omnibus e terris, Augustus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10589.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">habere mortem in conspicuo,</quote> <trans><tr>before the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 20:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 16, § 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10589.2" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">that attracts the attention to itself, striking, conspicuous, distinguished, illustrious, remarkable</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">fanero/s</foreign>; with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis conspicuum eum novitas divitiaeque faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis clara conspicuusque domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 467</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72 al.</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio, manu, voce insignis hosti, conspicuus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambo conspicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 373</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conspirate: <entryFree id="n10590" type="main" key="conspi_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. conspiro <sense id="n10590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conspiratio: <entryFree id="n10591" type="main" key="conspi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. conspiro</etym>, prop. <sense id="n10591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathing together</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10591.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of unison in wind instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">canentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10591.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement in feeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opinion, union, unanimity, concord, harmony</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10591.3" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">conspiratione hominum atque consensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15</bibl></cit>: omnium ordinum ad defendendam libertatem (with concordia), Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amici) quantā amoris conspiratione consentientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspiratio consensusque virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re publicā bene gerendā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10591.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a plotting, plot, mutiny, conspiracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 4, 11</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13</bibl>, a, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:2" default="NO">12, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 56</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10591.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the conspirators, body of conspirators</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tota ejus conspiratio late quaereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspiratus: <entryFree id="n10592" type="main" key="conspi_ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. conspiro <sense id="n10592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n10593" type="main" key="conspi_ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. conspiro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10594" type="main" key="conspi_ra_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. conspiro</etym>, <sense id="n10594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreement, harmony;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspiratu tacito mentium animorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspiro: <entryFree id="n10595" type="main" key="conspi_ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to blow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breathe together, to sound together</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10595.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aereaque adsensu conspirant cornua rauco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 615</bibl></cit> (et tubae simul inflabantur, Serv.).—Far more freq. and in good prose, </sense><sense id="n10595.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10595.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To harmonize, agree, accord</hi>: conspirans mutuus ardor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1216</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta rerum consentiens, conspirans, continuata cognatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium omnis vitae consentiens et paene conspirans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl>: in quibus (operibus) plurium conatus, praeeunte aliquā jucundā voce, conspirat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis ... animus, ut multae in illo artes ... multarum aetatum exempla, sed in unum conspirata,</quote> <trans><tr>harmoniously blending</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10595.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To agree together in thought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeling, to accord, unite, combine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10595.5" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">conligite vos, conspirate nobiscum, consentite cum bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabiliter populus Romanus universus et omnium generum ordinumque consensus ad liberandam rem publicam conspiravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: in commune conspirabatur ab utroque (Cic. Oecon.?) 12 praef. § 8. —</sense><sense id="n10595.6" n="b" level="4"> <mood>Part.</mood>: conspiratus, <hi rend="ital">mid., having agreed, combined; acting in concert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites legionis VIII. subito conspirati pila conjecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit> Kraner ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10595.7" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to plot together, to enter into a conspiracy, to conspire</hi> (so freq. in the histt. after the Aug. per., esp. in Suet.). </sense><sense id="n10595.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: priusquam plures civitates conspirarent, Caes. <cb n="CONS" /> B. G. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10595.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 56, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caedem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in destinatam mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3:section=21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Augustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit>.—Cf. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspiratum est in eum a sexaginta amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n10595.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad res novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 13</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10595.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Senatum adorirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspirasse corporis partes, ne manus ad os cibum ferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 10</bibl></cit>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10595.12" n="b" level="4"> <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">having conspired, having entered into a conspiracy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his conspiratis factionum partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>. —And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, like conjurati, <hi rend="ital">the conspirators</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 43</bibl>.— Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">conspīrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., with one accord, unanimously;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conspiratius ad arma concurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10596" type="main" key="conspi_ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>spira</etym>, <sense id="n10596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to coil up</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">anguis se conspiravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 22" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspissatio: <entryFree id="n10597" type="hapax" key="conspissa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspissātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>spisso</etym>, <sense id="n10597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing together, a thickening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordium,</quote> <trans><tr>an accumulation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspissatus: <entryFree id="n10598" type="main" key="conspissa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spissātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [id.], <sense id="n10598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressed together, thickened, condensed, dense</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">solum conspissatum et herbis colligatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 18, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consplendesco: <entryFree id="n10599" type="hapax" key="consplendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-splendesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to shine very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:66" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspolio: <entryFree id="n10600" type="main" key="conspo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to rob</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 98, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
conspolium: <entryFree id="n10601" type="gloss" key="conspo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sacrificial cake</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conspondeo: <entryFree id="n10602" type="main" key="consponde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spondĕo</orth>, <itype>ndi, nsum</itype> (old orthog. consposum, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 14</bibl> Müll.), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to engage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promise something mutually</hi> (ante- and postclass. and very rare): NEVE. CONSPONDISE. NEVE. CONPROMESISE. VELET., S. C. Bacch.; Wordsworth, Fragm. and Spec. p. 172: consponsi, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 70</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Paul. l. l.: consponsa factio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consponsata: <entryFree id="n10603" type="main" key="consponsa_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consponsāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sponso</etym>, <sense id="n10603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the betrothed, the bride</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consponsor: <entryFree id="n10604" type="main" key="consponsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sponsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n10604.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A joint surety</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10604.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who binds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obligates himself to something</hi> ( = conjurator), acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
consponsus: <entryFree id="n10605" type="main" key="consponsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consponsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conspondeo.</entryFree>
consposus: <entryFree id="n10606" type="main" key="conspo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. conspondeo <sense id="n10606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conspuo: <entryFree id="n10607" type="main" key="conspu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spŭo</orth>, no <sense id="n10607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10607.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to spit upon</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Petr.): me immundissimo basio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to spit upon in contempt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50</bibl>, n. 4; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Barth. Advers. 23, 24.—Of an epileptic: faciem tuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 44, p. 303, 1</bibl></cit>: conspuere sinus, <hi rend="ital">as a charm</hi> to prevent the gods from being provoked by proud words, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 111</bibl> Mayor ad loc.; cf. spuo, I.—</sense><sense id="n10607.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in a harsh and undignified figure, = conspergere, <hi rend="ital">to besprinkle, to cover over</hi>: Juppiter hibernas canā nive conspuit Alpes, Furius Bibaculus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which Horace, parodying it, writes: Furius hibernas cana nive conspuet Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. the scholiast in h. 1.—</sense><sense id="n10607.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to spit out much, to spit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem meam non averti a conspuentibus in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 50, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conspurco: <entryFree id="n10608" type="main" key="conspurco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spurco</orth>, no <sense id="n10608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to defile, pollute</hi> (rare): omnia taetro sapore, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juvenem) per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consputo: <entryFree id="n10609" type="main" key="conspu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-spūto</orth>, no <sense id="n10609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>conspuo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to spit upon in contempt</hi> (very rare): nostros coeperunt Clodiana, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictus et consputatus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idol. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consputus: <entryFree id="n10610" type="main" key="conspu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conspūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conspuo.</entryFree>
constabilio: <entryFree id="n10611" type="main" key="consta^bi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stăbĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, 4</itype>, <sense id="n10611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to confirm, establish, make firm</hi> (ante- and post-class. for stabilio, 2. fundo, and rare); only trop.: <pb n="437" /> <cb n="CONS" /> rem meam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 93</bibl>; so * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constagno: <entryFree id="n10612" type="main" key="constagno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stagno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, of fluids, = congelo, <sense id="n10612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to stand, to congeal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, p. 2198" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, p. 2198</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
constans: <entryFree id="n10613" type="main" key="constans1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from consto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10614" type="main" key="Constans2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constanter: <entryFree id="n10615" type="main" key="constanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consto, <sense id="n10615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
constantia: <entryFree id="n10616" type="main" key="constanti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. constans</etym>. <sense id="n10616.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A firm standing, steadiness, firmness, immutability, unchangeableness, constancy, perseverance</hi> (in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): (stellarum) perennes cursus atque perpetui cum admirabili incredibilique constantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">56, and 3, 9, 23: dictorum conventorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">promissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 19</bibl></cit> (17), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā constantiā vocis atque voltūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: perseverantia constantiaque oppugnandi, Auct. B. Alex. 26.—</sense><sense id="n10616.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">agreement, harmony, symmetry, consistency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimoniorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo et constantia et moderatio dictorum omnium atque factorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex singulis vocibus philosophi spectandi sunt, sed ex perpetuitate atque constantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (orationibus) forsitan magis requiratur constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiae causā,</quote> <trans><tr>for consistency's sake</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae autem est inter augures conveniens et conjuncta constantia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10616.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Firmness of character, steadfastness, immovability, constancy, self - possession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is, qui moderatione et constantiā quietus animo est sibi ipse placatus, ut nec tabescat molestiis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni cum incredibilem tribuisset natura gravitatem, eamque ipse perpetuā constantiā roborasset semperque in proposito susceptoque consilio permansisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si soceri Scauri constantiam (ceperis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam, non ... ardore quodam amoris, sed stabilitate potius et constantiā judicemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmamentum constantiae est fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc constantia, illinc furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 41, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eorum fide constantiāque dubitatis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>; Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.: sunt et alia ingenita quaedam adjumenta vox, latus, patiens laboris valetudo, constantia, decor, i. e. <hi rend="ital">natural firmness, intrepidity</hi>, Quint. prooem. § 27 Meyer.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl>, prooem. § 11; 12, 5, 2.— Acc. to the notions of the Stoics, = <foreign lang="greek">eu)pa/qeia</foreign>; in <number>plur.</number>: sic quattuor perturbationes sunt, tres constantiae ( = <foreign lang="greek">eu)paqei/as trei=s</foreign>, Diog. L. 7, 115), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 14</bibl>; cf. Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 8.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10617" type="main" key="Constantia2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 15, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 15, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constantiacus: <entryFree id="n10618" type="main" key="Constanti^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantĭăcus, Constantĭānus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Constantĭensis</orth>, v. Constantius.</entryFree>
constantina: <entryFree id="n10619" type="main" key="Constanti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n10619.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Constantine the Great</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10619.1" n="II" level="1"> The name of several cities, esp., </sense><sense id="n10619.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Mesopotamia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 7, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10619.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A later name of Cirta in Numidia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Constantine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 40:28" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 40, 28</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantīnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Constantine in Numidia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 17, 2, § 1</bibl></cit>: pugna, Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
constantinopolis: <entryFree id="n10620" type="main" key="Constanti_no^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantīnŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kwnstanti/nou polis</foreign>, <sense id="n10620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the city Constantinople</hi>, previously called Byzantium; Turkish <hi rend="ital">Stamboul</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Urb. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Parent. 3, 11 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantīnŏpŏlītā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Constantinople</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Constantinople</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: cives, Cod. Th. 11, 16, 6.</sense></entryFree>
constantinus: <entryFree id="n10621" type="main" key="Constanti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, C. Flavius Vaferius Claudius Constantinus, <sense id="n10621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Constantine, a well-known Roman emperor</hi>, born A. D. 274, died A. D. 323, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 2</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 18</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 10, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Constantine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavacrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONS" /></sense></entryFree>
constantius: <entryFree id="n10622" type="main" key="Constanti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman emperor who reigned from</hi> 292 A. D. to 306 A. D., <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 6</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 40" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 40</bibl>.—Hence, the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantĭānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Constantĭ-ensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Constantius</hi>: bellum, Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constat: <entryFree id="n10623" type="main" key="constat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constat</orth>, v. consto.</entryFree>
constellatio: <entryFree id="n10624" type="main" key="constella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stella</etym>, <sense id="n10624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collection of stars supposed to exert an influence upon human affairs, a constellation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ver. 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
constellatus: <entryFree id="n10625" type="main" key="constella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., starred, studded with stars</hi>: baltei, Treb. Gall. 2.</sense></entryFree>
consternatio: <entryFree id="n10626" type="main" key="consterna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consternātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. consterno</etym> (not ante-Aug.; mostly in histt.), <sense id="n10626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confusion, dismay, consternation, alarm, disquietude, disturbance</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10626.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor et consternatio mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa irae consternationisque subitae foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10626.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the fright</hi> of horses (with pavor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 42, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10626.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">mutiny, tumult, disorder, sedition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque plures consternatione proximā insanisse crediderim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusare apud regem consternationem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfectis consternationis auctoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:24" default="NO">8, 1, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consterno: <entryFree id="n10627" type="main" key="consterno1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10627.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strew over, cover by strewing, bestrew, to thatch, floor, pave, spread, cover</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10627.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula caespitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia gallinarum paleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula culmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aream silice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus molli fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidum mollibus plumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contabulationem summam lateribus lutoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec longuriis cratibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare classibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis constratus navigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile purpureā veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossaeis aethera saxis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia constrata telis, armis, cadaveribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos milite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum corporibus civium caede nocturnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late terram tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 543</bibl></cit>; cf.: terram gravi casu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1332</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">terram gravi corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=433" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem pontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10627.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum vias omnes constraveras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram frondes altae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem pontis in modum humo injecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, constrata navis, <hi rend="ital">covered, having a deck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 46, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vehicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10627.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">constrā-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n10627.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10627.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A deck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 6.—</sense><sense id="n10627.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw down, prostrate, level</hi> (very rare). * </sense><sense id="n10627.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas in Capitolio aliquot signa constravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">culcitae humi constratae, Jul. Epit. Nov. c. 4, § 15: montes erigat, campos tendat, maria consternat,</quote> <trans><tr>levels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephesus et Nicomedia constratae terrae motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 16:12" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10627.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: constrata ira, <hi rend="ital">moderated, subdued</hi> (the figure taken from animals conquered in combat), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10628" type="main" key="consterno2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consterno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>strengthened collat. form of 1. consterno, acc. to II.</etym>. <sense id="n10628.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch upon the ground, to overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecorum in modum consternatos (Gallos) caedunt fugantque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., esp. after the Aug. per. (not in Cic., Hor., or Quint.), </sense><sense id="n10628.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into confusion, to perplex; to terrify, alarm, affright, dismay, overwhelm with terror</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10628.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic sunt animo consternati ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">without animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23:90 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23, 90 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana Laetitia est, consternatique Timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 60</bibl></cit>: in fugam, <hi rend="ital">to put to flight by disquieting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alarming</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 43, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 46, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">foedā fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 79</bibl></cit> <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coriolanus prope ut amens consternatus ab sede suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10628.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">to make afraid, to frighten, startle;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: consternari, <hi rend="ital">to be frightened, to become shy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consternantur equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 96</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 41, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo ex odore cadaveris consternato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus securis ictu consternatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10628.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to excite to sedition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revolt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam multitudinem conjuratorum ad arma consternatam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 42, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 3, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
constipatio: <entryFree id="n10629" type="main" key="consti_pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constīpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>constipo</etym> (postclass.), <sense id="n10629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crowding together;</hi> in concr., <hi rend="ital">a dense crowd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
constipo: <entryFree id="n10630" type="main" key="consti_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stīpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowd closely together</hi> (very rare): tantum numerum hominum in agrum Campanum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (hostes) sub ipso vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11.</sense></entryFree>
